School of Business Administration |established = 1946 |type = [[public university|Public]] |dean = Larry Gianchetta |city = [[Missoula]] |state = [[Montana]] |country = [[United States|USA]] |students = |undergrad = |postgrad = |faculty = |staff = |campus = [[University of Montana]] |website = http://www.business.umt.edu |logo = |footnotes = }} The School of Business Administration, founded in 1918, is the oldest Business program in Montana. {{Cite web | title = Title Course Catalog - The University Of Montana | work = University of Montana | accessdate = 2011-09-23 | url = http://www.umt.edu/catalog/cat/soba/default.html }} The School grants an undergraduate and master's degree in business, as well as offering an innovative program in Entertainment Management and, it holds accreditation for its undergraduate and graduate business programs by AACSB International - [[The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business]].[http://www.business.umt.edu University of Montana Business School] ==History== {{Empty section|date=September 2010}} ==Majors== After completion of undergraduate core requirements UM students my pursue The School of Business and Administration's 6 majors: Accounting, Finance, International Business, Management, Management Information Systems, and Marketing. {{Cite web | title = Business Majors | accessdate = 2011-09-23 | url = http://www.business.umt.edu/degreesprograms/UndergraduateStudies/BusinessMajors.aspx }} ==Partnerships== The Business School maintains partnerships with six affiliate centers located in the Gallagher Business Building.[http://www.business.umt.edu/affiliate/ Affiliate Centers] #American Indian Business Leaders (AIBL) #America's Professor #Bureau of Business and Economic Research (BBER) #Montana Business Connections (MBC) #Montana Manufacturing Extension Center (MSU) #Montana World Trade Center ==Facilities== The Gallagher Business Building is equipped with a variety of rooms which are used for training and instruction. The rooms range from those built for presentation and computer training, to those equipped for conducting focus groups and video conferencing. The building contains three fully configured computer labs; three rooms specifically designed to enable video conferencing; thirteen spacious presentation rooms; and one room designed for conducting focus groups.[http://www.business.umt.edu/aboutus/technology.asp Technology@SoBA] Plans for a 21,400 foot Gilkey Executive Center that includes a 92-seat lecture hall and two second-floor tiered classrooms has been planned near the Gallagher Business Building but has not yet been built.[http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qa5289/is_20080925/ai_n30900054/ Ripley, Richard. Journal of Business.
